lines.text: [after Bond has escaped]
Mr. Bond is indeed of a very rare breed... soon to be made extinct.

[looking at the tattoo on Magda's back]
Forgive my curiosity, but, what is that?
That's my little octopussy.
Is he still there?
You must be joking! 007 on an island populated exclusively by women? We won't see him till dawn!
[Confronting James Bond]
You have a nasty habit of surviving.
You know what they say about the fittest.

[Q's mechanized version of the "Indian Rope Trick" malfunctions]
Having problems keeping it up, Q?
Experimental model!
Spend the money quickly, Mister Bond.

[General Orlov tries to board the circus train, but is shot down by the German border guards. General Gogol, who by now learned about Orlov's scheme, approaches the fatally-injured man, looking at him disdainfully]

[contemptuously]
A common thief. A disgrace to the uniform!
Yes, but tomorrow, I shall be a hero of the Soviet Union.
[despite his pain, Orlov smiles faintly, and then dies]
I believe I express the opinion of everyone present that adoption of NATO proposals does not compromise our defensive position.

[clears throat]
Comrade Chairman.
General Orlov.

General Gogol is presumptuous. He speaks for himself and others who cling to *timid*, outdated and unrealistic policies! Must I remind you, the committee, of our *overwhelming* superiority over NATO forces before we give it away?
Remember, 007, you're on your own.
Well, thank you, sir. That's a great comfort.

[preparing to leave the circus, where a bomb is placed]
General, excuse me. I have some traveling arrangements to make. Enjoy the show.
Thank you.
I'm sure the general will get a big blast out of this.
I know he won't be disappointed.
I guess this is good night.
I could come in for a nightcap.
[Gobinda puts a hand in front of Magda's door]
Some other time perhaps.

[Gobinda walks Bond back to his room]
I don't suppose you'd care for a nightcap?
[Bond and Q are floating in a hot air balloon]
I trust you can handle this contraption, Q?
It goes by hot air.
Oh, then you can.

[bad guys are chasing Bond and Vijay]
Vijay, we've got company!
No problem, this is a company car.
[car accelerates through crowds]

[after Bond bids for the egg]
Have you gone mad?
Let's see how badly he wants it.

[being kissed by Octopussy's girls after knocking out a bandit]
Cut it out! We don't have time for that! Later perhaps.

[enters the trailer, sees Bond in Mischka's 'Twin One' clothes from behind and mistakes him for Mischka]
Leave that! Let's go.

[turns around, facing Orlov with pointed gun]
Let's stay. Sit on that box. Hands on your knees. Come on, move! Now why is that bomb on the train?
Who are you?
I'm British Secret Service.
You should be more concerned about getting out of here alive.
I am more concerned about an atomic bomb exploding on a US Air Force base in West Germany! You surely can't be inviting a nuclear war? What happens when the US retaliates?

[grinning]
Against whom?

[frowning, realizing Orlov's scheme]
My God... of course. Our early-warning system will rule out the bomb having come from Russia or anywhere else. Everyone will assume incorrectly... that it was a American bomb triggered accidentally.
Yes, that would be the most plausible explanation.
Europe and NATO will then insist on full nuclear disarmament... and leaving every border undefended for you and the Warsaw Pact to walk across at will!
You took the words right out of my mouth.
And I suppose it doesn't matter a damn to you that thousands of innocent people will be killed in this little "accident" of yours?
Better than letting a handful of old men in Moscow bargain away our advantage in disarmament talks!
On your feet, General. You're going to stop that train.

[they hear hoot as the train starts to move off]
It's too late.
You can stop it at the border.
[suddenly the door opens. Bond turns around to see a Russian soldier. Bond kills the soldier before he manages to point his rifle, and meanwhile Orlov escapes]
[Bond is dragged from a river onto a tour boat]
Are you with our group?
No, ma'am, I'm with the economy tour!

[Q is demonstrating a pen filled with acid]
Dissolves all metals.
Wonderful for poison pen letters...
Pay attention, 007!
[Vijay has just stopped some bad guys with his tennis racket]
Game, set and match!
[first lines]
You didn't tell me there was going to be this much security.
They moved the flight up to this afternoon.
Well, we're going to have to go ahead as planned anyway.
[Bianca hands an ID badge with the name 'Luis Toro' to Bond]
Toro. Sounds like a load of bull.
[Twin Two throws several knives at Bond, which pass through his clothes, pinning him to a cabin door]

[draws another knife]
And this... for my brother...
[Bond plucks one of the knives from the door, and throws it at Twin Two, hitting him fatally in his stomach]
And that's for 009!

[the real Col. Luis Toro has found Bond]
Well, it's small world. You're a Toro, too!
A paid assassin.
When I kill it is on the specific orders of my Government.
I hope you have a pleasant stay.
[Bond eyes a beauty nearby who smiles at him]
I'm, ah, sure I will.

[handing a wad of Indian cash to his accomplice]
That should keep you in curry for a few weeks.
I would have taken that double, myself.
Then, why don't you take over the Major's position? Mr?
Bond, James Bond.

[Bond fights one of the thugs, throwing him onto a bed of nails]
Get out of my bed!
Who is he?
Englishman. Likes eggs, preferably Fabergé, and dice, preferably loaded.
[last lines]
[Bond is in traction]
I wish...
What?
I wish you weren't in such a weakened condition.
[Bond releases himself from traction]
Oh, James.
[Bond kisses Octopussy passionately]
James!

[In bed]
I need refilling.
Hmm? Of course you do.
[Grabs for a champagne bottle]

[using Kamal's loaded dice to beat him in backgammon]
Double sixes. Fancy that!

[he tosses all his money to the crowd]
Easy comes, easy goes!

[runs into a tiger in the jungle]
Sit!
You had no business bidding for that egg! What would you have done if you'd had been stuck with it?
Then I would have claimed it was a fake, sir... and not paid.
Not paid?
Here is the real one. I swiped it with the fake at the auction.
Good God. And what happens when the buyer discovers this?
He complains.
Well?

I don't think he will complain. According to Fanning, this Kamal usually sells. Now he buys. I think the fake will smoke him out. I had a tail follow him to Heathrow, where he caught a plane to Delhi.
You must go there, too. I'll have Sadruddin, our man at Station I, there to assist you.
Yes, well, I have exactly 35 minutes to catch that plane.
Oh, Bond... sign a chit for that egg on your way out... it's government property now.
The Englishman has escaped!
He won't go very far. We'll track him.

[Bond's jet is on empty but he manages to land it next to a gas station and the pump attendant comes out to greet him]
Fill er' up, please!
World Socialism will be achieved peaceably. Our military role is strictly defensive. Is that understood?
Well, I must say you've become more beautiful everyday.
*I'm* over here.
Oh, of course you are.
And this is Miss Penelope Smallbone - my new assistant.
What can I say Miss Moneypenny, except to say that she is - as attractive and, eh, - as charming...
As I used to be?
I didn't say that.
You're such a flatter, James.
Oh, Moneypenny, you know there never has been and - there never will be anybody but you.
So, you've told me.
Welcome to universal exports.
[Bond gives Miss Smallbone a bouquet of red carnations]
Take it dear, that's all you'll ever get from him.
Thank you, Commander Bond.
You know me?
Miss Moneypenny described you.
In nauseating detail.
Really?
Do you know what this is?

Why, it looks like a Fabergé egg, sir. One of the jeweled eggs made by Carl Fabergé as an Easter gift to the Russian royal family. They're priceless and very rare. This one contains a model of the imperial stage coach.
Top marks, 007.
Thank you, sir.
Except - it's a fake.
Eyes only, 007. Operation Trove. You'll be replacing 009. He turned up dead in East Germany with that egg in his hand.
A lightening thrust by ten armored divisions from the north and by five more through Czechoslovakia, leads to total victory in five days against any possible defense scenario.
This is absolute madness! We know where it will end. NATO will counterattack with nuclear weapons!
Never! The West is decadent - and divided! It has no stomach to risk our atomic reprisals! Throughout Europe daily demonstrations demand unilateral nuclear disarmament.
I see no reason to risk war to satisfy your personal paranoia and thirst for conquest!
May I join you? Sotheby's. Half a million pounds.
The man at the auction.
Precisely.
You have a very good memory for faces.
And figures.
Ah, Q - how are you?
Most unhappy, 007, thanks to you. How can I be expected to maintain the quality of my work? Sent out here at a moment's notice! No proper facilities!
Yes, well, you wouldn't have a small piece of thread, now. Somebody seems to have stuck a knife in my wallet.
Ah, they missed you. What a pity!
I've also mislaid my PPK.
Anything else?
No, that's all Q.
Really, 007! Look, I haven't time for these adolescent antics!
Let's put it this way, up to now you are the least lethal and, by far, the prettiest of Kamal's friends that I've come across.
Thank you.
So, does he have a proposition for me or - do you?
He suggests trade. The egg - for you life.
Well, I heard the price of eggs was going up, but, isn't that a little high?
It's for my scrapbook. I collect - memories.
Well, let's get on with - making a few.
In. Out. In. Out. In. Out. Come on, girls! In. Out.
Good evening, Mr. Bond.
Good evening.
Well rested? I believe you and Miss Magda have - met?
It was a pleasure.
You're too kind.
At the risk of appearing to be making light dinner conversation, may I ask exactly why I'm here?
It belongs to a fabulously wealthy woman who lives on the floating palace.
Who is she?
No one knows her real name; but, she's known as Octopussy.
Well, that's the name I heard at Kamal's.
I hear the island is fully of beautiful women. No men allowed.
Really? Sexual discrimination. I'll definitely have to pay it a visit.
Good evening. I wondered when you might arrive.
So you are the mysterious Octopussy.
And you are James Bond, 007, Licensed to Kill. Am I to be your target tonight?
Octopussy, I would enjoy another opportunity to take care of Mr. Bond, personally.
I will take care of Mr. Bond, myself.
Good night. And, enjoy yourself, Mr. Bond.
Mr. Bond, smuggling is no concern of the Secret Service. I've violated no English law. You're free to leave; but, I'd much rather prefer if you'd stay as my guest for a few days.
I'd like that.
Oh, a man of principal - with a price on his head. Naturally you do it for Queen and Country. I have no country. I have no price on my head!

[James embraces and kisses Octopussy]
No!
You're right, we are two of a kind.
[Kiss]
Oh - James!
Is something wrong?
Not really. Just a feeling.
Why don't you come back to bed.
My government categorically denies the incident ever occurred.
